questions.question: What is the purpose of the `contain` property in CSS?
options: To limit the scope of styles to the containing element for performance improvements.
To define the width and height of an element.
To specify the padding inside an element.
To create a flex container.
questions.answer: To limit the scope of styles to the containing element for performance improvements.

questions.question: What does the `will-change` property do in CSS?
options: It provides a hint to the browser about which elements are likely to change, helping optimize performance.
It triggers an animation when an element's state changes.
It defines how the browser should handle responsive layouts.
It is used to set the transition duration of an element.
questions.answer: It provides a hint to the browser about which elements are likely to change, helping optimize performance.

questions.question: What is the purpose of `@supports` in CSS?
options: To apply styles conditionally, based on browser support for a specific CSS feature.
To detect screen resolution and apply different styles.
To handle animation keyframes.
To set breakpoints for responsive designs.
questions.answer: To apply styles conditionally, based on browser support for a specific CSS feature.

questions.question: How do CSS Grid's `grid-template-areas` work?
options: It allows you to define named areas on the grid, which can be referenced by grid items.
It specifies the number of columns and rows in the grid.
It defines the gutter spacing between grid items.
It enables grid items to overlap.
questions.answer: It allows you to define named areas on the grid, which can be referenced by grid items.

questions.question: What is the function of the `clip-path` property?
options: It defines a region of an element that is visible, hiding the rest of the element.
It specifies the z-index of an element.
It defines the maximum size an element can grow to.
It creates transitions between elements.
questions.answer: It defines a region of an element that is visible, hiding the rest of the element.

questions.question: Which CSS function can be used to apply 3D transformations to an element?
options: transform: rotateX(45deg);
scale(1.5);
rotateZ(90deg);

questions.question: What does the `backface-visibility` property control in CSS?
options: It controls whether the back side of an element is visible when transformed.
It adjusts the z-index of a 3D element.
It specifies the perspective of a 3D element.
It changes the background of an element during an animation.
questions.answer: It controls whether the back side of an element is visible when transformed.

questions.question: How does the `filter` property work in CSS?
options: It applies graphical effects like blur or brightness to an element.
It filters child elements based on certain criteria.
It specifies the opacity of an element.
It controls the visibility of an element.
questions.answer: It applies graphical effects like blur or brightness to an element.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `perspective` property in CSS?
options: It defines how far an element is placed from the view to create a 3D effect.
It creates a parallax scrolling effect.
It adjusts the visibility of an element's background.
It specifies how an element responds to media queries.
questions.answer: It defines how far an element is placed from the view to create a 3D effect.

questions.question: Which pseudo-class can be used to style an element when its child is being hovered?
options: :has()
:nth-child()
:child-hover()
:hover-child()

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `object-fit` property?
options: It defines how an image or video should be resized to fit its container.
It controls the spacing between inline elements.
It adjusts the text alignment inside an element.
It applies transformations to an object.
questions.answer: It defines how an image or video should be resized to fit its container.

questions.question: What does the `isolation` property control in CSS?
options: It defines a new stacking context to prevent elements from blending with each other.
It adjusts the margin between block-level elements.
It controls the isolation of flex items within a container.
It sets the isolation level of an element from the document flow.
questions.answer: It defines a new stacking context to prevent elements from blending with each other.

questions.question: Which property is used to create a smooth scroll effect?
options: scroll-behavior
scroll-smooth
scrollbar-style
scrolling-effect

questions.question: How does the `@keyframes` rule work in CSS animations?
options: It defines the intermediate steps for an animation sequence.
It sets the duration for an animation to complete.
It specifies how elements respond to user interaction.
It controls the position of an element in 3D space.
questions.answer: It defines the intermediate steps for an animation sequence.

questions.question: What does the `mix-blend-mode` property do?
options: It defines how an element's content should blend with the content behind it.
It creates a transition effect between multiple elements.
It specifies the blending effect for a gradient.
It mixes the background color with the element's border color.
questions.answer: It defines how an element's content should blend with the content behind it.
